ygData.subject: RE: spells and mana (was I give up)
ygData.msgSnippet: When I got my DR I stopped using Siphon as well (since the DR does more than the spell does, doesn t make much sense to use it). I have no clue on how much
ygData.messageBody:
When I got my DR I stopped using Siphon as well (since the DR does more than
the spell does, doesn't make much sense to use it).

I have no clue on how much wave does, since you don't get any off it (if you
do I didn't notice - Shaman are nice to have around as well btw). I've cast
wave a few times, but again the whole AE thing is only good if you want to
see how much damage you can take in the shortest amount of time possible.
(Hint: Never test it on 4 Greater Minos. Really bad idea. At least they left
the cleric alone long enough to kill me :)

Thom


-----Original Message-----
From: Chip Paul [mailto:cpaul@...]
Sent: Friday, September 17, 1999 2:14 PM
To: shadowknight@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [shadowknight] spells and mana (was I give up)


From: Chip Paul <cpaul@...>

"Wilson, ThomasX B" wrote:
>
> From: "Wilson, ThomasX B" <thomasx.b.wilson@...>
>
> As for running out of Mana (My Int is 115 btw), I actually can quite
easily
> in a big fight. Cast Darkness and Boil Blood a few times and suddenly your
> OOM.
>

Well, that statement was made based on level 29, since I haven't
played much at level 30. I'm sure with Heat Blood I can chew through
some mana even faster. I have a 113 Int, more if my guild jeweler
gets a little better

Question on Wave of Enfeeblement - how much does it siphon? Is
anyone else using this? I have a Dark Reaver so I switched to it
instead of siphon and rely on the proc to raise my str. Casting
time on Wave is pretty long it seems.

I saved myself with feign for the first time last night, the
casting time seemed reasonable to me (since I lived).


Xilith
